javadoc:
NOTE:  ALL AnnotatedStringHandler CLASSES MUST END IN "StringHandler".  If not,
 the ClassSearcher will not find them.
 
 An interface that describes a string that has been annotated, which allows for adding
 rendering and functionality to strings.

methods.name: createAnnotatedString
methods.comment:
Creates an FieldElement based upon the give array of Strings.  The first String
 in the list is expected to be the annotation tag used to create the annotation.  At the
 very least the array is expected to be comprised of two elements, the annotation and some
 data.  Extra data may be provided as needed by implementing classes.

params.name: prototypeString
params.comment:
The prototype FieldElement that dictates the
         attributes for the newly created string.  Implementations may change attributes
         as needed.

params.name: text
params.comment:
An array of Strings used to create the FieldElement being
         returned.

params.name: program
params.comment: The program with which the returned string is associated.

throws.comment:
if the given text data does not fit the expected format for
         the given handler implementation.

return.comment: An AnnotatedTextFieldElement that will be used to render the given text.

methods.name: getSupportedAnnotations
methods.comment:
Returns the annotation string names that this AnnotatedStringHandler supports (e.g., "symbol",
 "address", etc...).

return.comment: the annotation string names that this AnnotatedStringHandler supports.

methods.name: handleMouseClick
methods.comment:
A method that is notified when an annotation is clicked.  Returns true if this annotation
 handles the click; return false if this annotation does not do anything with the click.

params.name: annotationParts
params.comment: The constituent parts of the annotation

params.name: sourceNavigatable
params.comment: The location in the program that was clicked.

params.name: serviceProvider
params.comment: A service provider for needed services.

return.comment:
true if this annotation handles the click; return false if this annotation does 
         not do anything with the click.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the String that represents the GUI presence of this option
@return the String to display in GUI components.
methods.name: getDisplayString
methods.comment: Returns the String that represents the GUI presence of this option

return.comment: the String to display in GUI components.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an example string of how the annotation is used
@return the example of how this is used.
methods.name: getPrototypeString
methods.comment: Returns an example string of how the annotation is used

return.comment: the example of how this is used.

name: AnnotatedStringHandler
comment:
NOTE:  ALL AnnotatedStringHandler CLASSES MUST END IN "StringHandler".  If not,
 the ClassSearcher will not find them.
 
 An interface that describes a string that has been annotated, which allows for adding
 rendering and functionality to strings.
